atomic formulas and all compounds thence constructible"- W.V.Quine

theorize.definition:
2) construct a theory about

2) a warning that something unpleasant is imminent

tupi-guarani.definition: a family of South American Indian languages

tupik.definition: tent that is an Eskimo summer dwelling

tupungato.definition: a mountain in the Andes on the border between Argentina and Chile (22,310 feet high)

turban.definition: a traditional Muslim headdress consisting of a long scarf wrapped around the head

turbidity.definition: muddiness created by stirring up sediment or having foreign particles suspended

turbinate.definition: of or relating to the scroll-shaped turbinate bones in the nasal passages

turbine.definition: rotary engine in which the kinetic energy of a moving fluid is converted into mechanical energy by causing a bladed rotor to rotate

turbogenerator.definition: generator consisting of a steam turbine coupled to an electric generator for the production of electric power

turbot.definition:
1) flesh of a large European flatfish
2) a large brownish European flatfish

turbulence.definition:
1) unstable flow of a liquid or gas
2) instability in the atmosphere
3) a state of violent disturbance and disorder (as in politics or social conditions generally)

examples.en: the industrial revolution was a period of great turbulence

turbulently.definition: in a turbulent manner; with turbulence

turdidae.definition: thrushes; in some classifications considered a subfamily (Turdinae) of the family Muscicapidae

tureen.definition: large deep serving dish with a cover; for serving soups and stews

turf.definition:

2) the territory claimed by a juvenile gang as its own
3) range of jurisdiction or influence

examples.en: a bureaucracy...chiefly concerned with turf...and protecting the retirement system

turgenev.definition: Russian writer of stories and novels and plays (1818-1883)

examples.en: he lectured bombastically about his theories

turgor.definition: (biology) the normal rigid state of fullness of a cell or blood vessel or capillary resulting from pressure of the contents against the wall or membrane

turgot.definition: French economist who in 1774 was put in control of finances by Louis XVI; his proposals for reforms that involved abolishing feudal privileges made him unpopular with the aristocracy and in 1776 he was dismissed (1727-1781)

turin.definition: capital city of the Piemonte region of northwestern Italy

turing.definition: English mathematician who conceived of the Turing machine and broke German codes during World War II (1912-1954)

turk.definition: a native or inhabitant of Turkey

turkey.definition:
1) large gallinaceous bird with fan-shaped tail; widely domesticated for food
2) a Eurasian republic in Asia Minor and the Balkans; on the collapse of the Ottoman Empire in 1918, the Young Turks, led by Kemal Ataturk, established a republic in 1923
4) flesh of large domesticated fowl usually roasted

turki.definition:
1) any member of the peoples speaking a Turkic language
2) a subfamily of Altaic languages

turkic.definition: of or relating to the people who speak the Turkic language

turkish.definition: of or relating to or characteristic of Turkey or its people or language

turkistan.definition: a historical region of central Asia that was a center for trade between the East and the West

turkmen.definition:
1) of or relating to or characteristic of Turkmenistan or its people or culture
3) the Turkic language spoken by the Turkoman

turkmenistan.definition: a republic in Asia to the east of the Caspian Sea and to the south of Kazakhstan and to the north of Iran; an Asian soviet from 1925 to 1991

turkoman.definition: a member of a Turkic people living in Turkmenistan and neighboring areas

turmeric.definition:
1) widely cultivated tropical plant of India having yellow flowers and a large aromatic deep yellow rhizome; source of a condiment and a yellow dye
2) ground dried rhizome of the turmeric plant used as seasoning

turn.definition:
1) change orientation or direction, also in the abstract sense
2) the act of changing or reversing the direction of the course
3) (game) the activity of doing something in an agreed succession

examples.en: The mugger turned and fled before I could see his face
he took a turn to the right

turnaround.definition:
1) time need to prepare a vessel or ship for a return trip
3) an area sufficiently large for a vehicle to turn around
4) act or process of unloading and loading and servicing a vessel or aircraft for a return trip

turnbuckle.definition: an oblong metal coupling with a swivel at one end and an internal thread at the other into which a threaded rod can be screwed in order to form a unit that can be adjusted for length or tension

turncock.definition: one employed to control water supply by turning water mains on and off

turned.definition: moved around an axis or center

turner.definition:
1) United States slave and insurrectionist who in 1831 led a rebellion of slaves in Virginia; he was captured and executed (1800-1831)
2) United States endocrinologist (1892-1970)
3) English landscape painter whose treatment of light and color influenced the French impressionists (1775-1851)

turnery.definition:
1) workshop where objects are made on a lathe
2) products made on a lathe

turnicidae.definition: small Old World birds resembling but not related to true quail

turning.definition:
2) act of changing in practice or custom
3) a shaving created when something is produced by turning it on a lathe

examples.en: the law took many turnings over the years

turnip.definition:

2) root of any of several members of the mustard family

turnip-shaped.definition: shaped in the form of a turnip

turnix.definition: type genus of the Turnicidae: button quail

turnoff.definition:

examples.en: I missed the turnoff and went 15 miles out of my way

turnout.definition:

6) attendance for a particular event or purpose (as to vote in an election)

turnover.definition: a dish made by folding a piece of pastry over a filling

turnpike.definition:
1) (from 16th to 19th centuries) gates set across a road to prevent passage until a toll had been paid
2) an expressway on which tolls are collected

turnspit.definition: a roasting spit that can be turned

turnstile.definition: a gate consisting of a post that acts as a pivot for rotating arms; set in a passageway for controlling the persons entering

turntable.definition:

2) a revolving tray placed on a dining table
3) a rotatable platform with a track; used to turn locomotives and cars

turnverein.definition: a club of tumblers or gymnasts

turpentine.definition:
1) obtained from conifers (especially pines)
2) volatile liquid distilled from turpentine oleoresin; used as paint thinner and solvent and medicinally

turquoise.definition: a blue to grey green mineral consisting of copper aluminum phosphate

examples.en: blue turquoise is valued as a gemstone

turret.definition: a small tower extending above a building

turtle.definition: hunt for turtles, especially as an occupation

turtledove.definition: any of several Old World wild doves

turtleneck.definition: a sweater or jersey with a high close-fitting collar

turtler.definition: someone whose occupation is hunting turtles

tuscaloosa.definition: a university town in west central Alabama

tuscan.definition:
1) of or relating to or characteristic of Tuscany or its people
2) a dialect of Italian spoken in Tuscany (especially Florence)

tuscarora.definition:
1) a member of an Iroquois people who formerly lived in North Carolina and then moved to New York State and joined the Iroquois
2) the Iroquoian language spoken by the Tuscarora

tushery.definition: writing of poor quality; characterized by affected choice of archaic words

tusker.definition: any mammal with prominent tusks (especially an elephant or wild boar)

tussah.definition: oriental moth that produces brownish silk

tussaud.definition: French modeler (resident in England after 1802) who made wax death masks of prominent victims of the French Revolution and toured Britain with her wax models; in 1835 she opened a permanent waxworks exhibition in London (1761-1850)

tussilago.definition: genus of low creeping yellow-flowered perennial herbs of north temperate regions: coltsfoots; in some classifications includes species often placed in other genera especially Homogyne and Petasites

tutankhamen.definition: Pharaoh of Egypt around 1358 BC; his tomb was discovered almost intact by Howard Carter in 1922

tutelage.definition: teaching pupils individually (usually by a tutor hired privately)

tutelo.definition:

tutor.definition:
1) be a tutor to someone; give individual instruction

tutorial.definition: of or relating to tutors or tutoring

tutorially.definition: by tutorials; in a tutorial manner

tutti-frutti.definition: ice cream containing chopped candied fruits

tutu.definition: South African prelate and leader of the antiapartheid struggle (born in 1931)

tuvalu.definition:
1) a small island republic on the Tuvalu islands; formerly part of the British colony of Gilbert and Ellice Islands until it withdrew in 1975 and became independent of the United Kingdom in 1978
2) a group of coral islands in Micronesia to the southwest of Hawaii

twaddler.definition: someone who twaddles; someone who writes or talks twaddle

twang.definition:

twerp.definition: someone who is regarded as contemptible

twig.definition: branch out in a twiglike manner

twinkle.definition:
